title: NHL roundup: Islanders roll to third straight win at Barclays Center
text:
NHL roundup: Islanders roll to third straight win at Barclays Center October 18, 2015 Last updated: Sunday, October 18, 2015, 1:21 AM THE ASSOCIATED PRESS | Print 
Kyle Okposo scored the tiebreaking goal early in the third period and added two assists as the Islanders beat San Jose, 6-3, Saturday night at Barclays Center, handing the Sharks their first loss of the season. 
Johnny Boychuk, Anders Lee, Josh Bailey, Brock Nelson and Frans Nielsen also scored to help the Islanders win their third straight — all at their new Brooklyn home. 
Goalie Jaroslav Halak made his season debut after missing the first four games with an undisclosed upper-body injury and finished with 22 saves. 
Joe Pavelski, Nikolay Goldobin and Joel Ward scored for San Jose, which opened the season 4-0-0. Alex Stalock stopped 28 shots. 
On the go-ahead goal, Okposo got the rebound of his own shot behind the net, skated around Sharks defender Brenden Dillon and beat Stalock to put the Islanders up for good. 
PENGUINS 2, MAPLE LEAFS 1 (at Pittsburgh) — Evgeni Malkin and Olli Maatta scored first-period goals and Pittsburgh held on for a victory over Toronto. 
CANADIENS 4, RED WINGS 1 (at Montreal) — Jeff Petry scored the go-ahead goal 6:32 into the third period and Montreal moved to 6-0-0 for the first time in franchise history with a victory over Detroit. 
CAPITALS 4, HURRICANES 1 (at Washington) — Nicklas Backstrom, back from arthroscopic hip surgery, had a goal and two assists in his season debut to lead Washington to a victory over Carolina. 
STARS 4, PANTHERS 2 (at Sunrise, Fla.) — Tyler Seguin and Jamie Benn scored two goals each to rally Dallas to a victory over Florida. Patrick Sharp added two assists and Jari Lehtonen stopped 22 shots to improve to 3-0-0. 
LIGHTNING 2, SABRES 1 (at Tampa, Fla.) — Goalie Ben Bishop set a team record for career wins with his 84th, Alex Killorn scored a go-ahead goal with 3:57 left and Tampa Bay beat Buffalo. 
PREDATORS 4, SENATORS 3, SO (at Ottawa) — James Neal scored twice in regulation and the shootout winner as Nashville defeated Ottawa.
